column4: Hey, Can anyone help me add a custom menu entry to my  boot options in Grub 2? I have a link but I dont seem to be able to understand much. I am running 10.10 and trying to dualboot with windows
do you know which partition windows is on?
This is the link I am trying to use https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Grub2#Custom%20Menu%20Entries
Niohubala: yes I have a screen shot of disk utility if youd like
go to disk management, click your windows partition, and look at the partition number
yes sir. that would be it lol
now I just need help using this link https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Grub2#Custom%20Menu%20Entries
I'm no expert but try adding this to /boot/grub/grub.cfg: http://pastebin.com/iCZFk5Kn
I think that may just be applicable to Grub. 10.10 uses grub 2
It was taken from my grub.cfg file and I'm on grub 2
Does anyone have enough experience to know how to add custom menu entries to grub 2?
